title: Punxsutawney Phil through the years

organizations.name: ap none the punxsutawney groundhog club

text: Let friends in your social network know what you are reading about Facebook Email Punxsutawney Phil through the years Groundhog handler Ben Hughes watches Punxsutawney Phil after he did not see his shadow predicting an early spring during the 125th annual Groundhog Day festivities on Feb. 2, 2011 in Punxsutawney, Pa. Post to Facebook Punxsutawney Phil through the years Groundhog handler Ben Hughes watches Punxsutawney Phil after he did not see his shadow predicting an early spring during the 125th annual Groundhog Day festivities on Feb. 2, 2011 in Punxsutawney, Pa. Check out this story on USATODAY.com: http://usat.ly/2k0cyc0 Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Nation's Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Punxsutawney Phil through the years None Groundhog handler Ben Hughes watches Punxsutawney Phil after he did not see his shadow predicting an early spring during the 125th annual Groundhog Day festivities on Feb. 2, 2011 in Punxsutawney, Pa. Jeff Swensen, Getty Images None Groundhog handler John Griffiths holds Punxsutawney Phil after he saw his shadow predicting 6 more weeks of winter during 126th annual Groundhog Day festivities on Feb. 2, 2012 in Punxsutawney, Pa. Jeff Swensen, Getty Images None Punxsutawney Phil takes a bite out of the gloved hand of handler Ron Ploucha during the 129th celebration of Groundhog Day on Gobbler's Knob in Punxsutawney, Pa. Feb. 2, 2015. Phil's handlers said that the groundhog has forecast six more weeks of winter weather. Gene J. Puskar, AP None Jim Means holds up a sleepy Punxsutawney Phil at daybreak, Feb. 2, 1980, in Punxsutawney, Pa., in front of a crowd of anxious people. The groundhog saw his shadow and proclaimed six more weeks of winter. Means cares for Phil throughout the year in the animal's home in the town library. AP None Punxsutawney Phil is held by handler Bill Deeley after emerging from his Gobbler's Knob burrow at sunrise Feb. 2, 2002 before a record crowd of some 25,000 in Punxsutawney, Pa. Phil saw his shadow and predicted six more weeks of winter weather. Gene J. Puskar, AP None Punxsutawney Phil is held by handler Bill Deeley, right, as he tells Punxsutawney Groundhog Club President Bill Cooper, left, he saw his shadow upon emerging from his burrow at 7:27 a.m. Feb. 2, 2004, and predicted six more weeks of winter. Gene J. Puskar, AP None Punxsutawney Phil is held up by his handler Bill Deeley while holding a "Terrible Towel" after the prediction of six more weeks of winter was announced in Punxsutawney, Pa. on Feb. 2, 2006. Keith Srakocic, AP None Punxsutawney Phil is held by Ben Hughes after emerging from his burrow on Gobblers Knob in Punxsutawney, Pa., to see his shadow and forecast six more weeks of winter weather Feb. 2, 2010. Gene J. Puskar, AP None Punxsutawney Phil after emerging from his burrow on Gobblers Knob in Punxsutawney, Pa., to see his shadow and forecast six more weeks of winter weather Feb. 2, 2010. Gene J. Puskar, AP None Groundhog Punxsutawney Phil is held by Punxsutawney Groundhog Club handler Ben Hughes during an appearance at the 2008 Pennsylvania Farm Show in the Pennsylvania Farm Show Complex and Expo Center Jan. 8, 2008, in Harrisburg, Pa. Phil did not predict any weather trends during his stop at the Farm Show. Carolyn Kaster, AP None Sam Light, center, president of the Punxsutawney Groundhog Club, points to a sign held by members of the club in Gobbler's Knob, Punxsutawney, Pa, Jan. 1961. They posed for the picture a few days before Groundhog Day, Feb. 2, with a stuffed stand-in for Punxsutawney Phil. AP None Punxsutawney Phil's handler Bill Deeley, holds Phil out to some of the over 10,000 faithful who braved single digit temperatures on Gobbler's Knob in Punxsutawney, Pa., Feb. 2, 1996. Phil saw his shadow and forecast six more weeks of winter. Gene J. Puskar, AP None Handler Bill Deeley holds Punxsutawney Phil, who greets visitors to his burrow on Gobblers Knob in Punxsutawney, Pa., on Feb. 2, 1999. Phil didn't see his shadow, and predicted an early spring. Gene J. Puskar, AP None Punxsutawney Phil stands on the shoulder of his handler John Griffiths after the Groundhog Club claimed that Phil did not see his shadow and winter has ended on Groundhog Day Feb. 2, 2011. Keith Srakocic, AP None Punxsutawney Phil stands on the shoulder of one of his handlers John Griffiths while looking at other handler Ben Hughes, after the Groundhog Club claimed that Phil did not see his shadow and winter has ended on Groundhog Day Feb. 2, 2011, in Punxsutawney, Pa. Keith Srakocic, AP None Punxsutawney Phil crawls off the shoulder of handler Ben Hughes during the annual Groundhog Day festivities Feb. 2, 2011, in Punxsutawney, Pa. The Groundhog Club claimed that Phil did not see his shadow and predicted that winter has ended on Groundhog Day. Keith Srakocic, AP None Groundhog Club handler Ron Ploucha holds Punxsutawney Phil during the 126th celebration of Groundhog Day on Gobbler's Knob in Punxsutawney, Pa. Feb. 2, 2012. Phil saw his shadow, forecasting six more weeks of winter weather. Gene J. Puskar, AP None The Punxsutawney Groundhog Club gathers at Gobbler's Knob during the 126th celebration of Groundhog Day on Gobbler's Knob in Punxsutawney, Pa. Feb. 2, 2012. Phil saw his shadow, forecasting six more weeks of winter weather. Gene J. Puskar, AP None Groundhog Club handler Ron Ploucha holds Punxsutawney Phil during the 126th celebration of Groundhog Day on Gobbler's Knob in Punxsutawney, Pa. Feb. 2, 2012. Phil saw his shadow, forecasting six more weeks of winter weather. Gene J. Puskar, AP None Groundhog Club handler John Griffiths, left, and Ron Ploucha place Punxsutawney Phil in his viewing cage, during the 126th celebration of Groundhog Day on Gobbler's Knob in Punxsutawney, Pa. Feb. 2, 2012. Phil saw his shadow, forecasting six more weeks of winter weather. Gene J. Puskar, AP None Groundhog Club handler John Griffiths holds Punxsutawney Phil during the annual celebration of Groundhog Day on Gobbler's Knob in Punxsutawney, Pa., Feb. 2, 2016. Phil's handlers said that the groundhog has forecast Winter has ended. Keith Srakocic, AP None Groundhog Club co-handlers John Griffiths, right, and Ron Ploucha, carry Punxsutawney Phil on his rounds of downtown Punxsutawney, Pa. Feb.1, 2015, the eve of the 129th Groundhog Day celebration on Gobbler's Knob. Gene J. Puskar, AP None Punxsutawney Phil is held by Ron Ploucha after emerging from his burrow Feb. 2, 2014, on Gobblers Knob in Punxsutawney, Pa., to see his shadow and forecast six more weeks of winter weather. Gene J. Puskar, AP None Groundhog Club handler Ron Ploucha, right, holds Punxsutawney Phil as Jeff Lundy reads Phil's weather proclamation of six-more weeks of winter during the 129th celebration of Groundhog Day on Gobbler's Knob in Punxsutawney, Pa., Feb. 2, 2015. Gene J. Puskar, AP None Ground Hog Club President Bill Deeley, center, knocks on the burrow of Punxsutawney Phil on Gobblers Knob in Punxsutawney, Pa. Feb. 2, 2014. Phil saw his shadow and forecast six more weeks of winter weather. Gene J. Puskar, AP None Groundhog Club co-handler John Griffiths holds Punxsutawney Phil during the annual celebration of Groundhog Day on Gobbler's Knob in Punxsutawney, Pa., Feb. 2, 2016. The handlers say the furry rodent has failed to see his shadow predicting an early spring. Keith Srakocic, AP None Punxsutawney Phil is held by the gloved hands of handler Ron Ploucha during the 129th celebration of Groundhog Day on Gobbler's Knob in Punxsutawney, Pa. Feb. 2, 2015. Phil saw his shadow, predicting six more weeks of winter weather. Gene J. Puskar, AP None Groundhog Club handler Ron Ploucha holds Punxsutawney Phil, the weather prognosticating groundhog, as co-handler John Griffiths rubs his head, during the 129th celebration of Groundhog Day on Gobbler's Knob in Punxsutawney, Pa., Feb. 2, 2015. Phil saw his shadow, predicting six more weeks of winter weather. Gene J. Puskar, AP None Ben Hughes, handler of the weather-predicting groundhog Punxsutawney Phil, holds Phil in the air after removing him from his stump at Gobbler's Knob on Groundhog Day, Feb. 2, 2009, in Punxsutawney, Pa. The Groundhog Club said Phil saw his shadow and predicted six more weeks of winter. Carolyn Kaster, AP None Punxsutawney Groundhog Club President Bill Cooper listens as Punxsutawney Phil emerges from his burrow to see his shadow and forecast six more weeks of winter Feb. 2, 1998, on Gobbler's Knob in Punxsutawney, Pa. Gene J. Puskar, AP None Groundhog handler Ron Ploucha holds Punxsutawney Phil after he saw his shadow predicting six more weeks of winter during the 128th annual Groundhog Day festivities on Feb. 2, 2014 in Punxsutawney, Pa. Jeff Swensen, Getty Images None Punxsutawney Phil relaxes in his cage after he saw his shadow predicting six more weeks of winter during the 128th annual Groundhog Day festivities on Feb. 2, 2014, in Punxsutawney, Pa. Jeff Swensen, Getty Images None Groundhog handler John Griffiths holds Punxsutawney Phil after he saw his shadow predicting six more weeks of winter during the 128th annual Groundhog Day festivities on Feb. 2, 2014, in Punxsutawney, Pa. Jeff Swensen, Getty Images None Handler Bill Deeley holds Punxsutawney Phil as Punxsutawney Groundhog club President William Cooper reads the proclamation that there would be six more weeks of winter after Phil saw his shadow in Puxsutawney, Pa. on Feb. 2, 2005.
